Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2016 07:05PM Emaca wrote: the mammo and ultra sound may or may not be read right away depending on your center. I had a call back from a routine mammo for more views and ultra sound and the radiologist came in after viewing films and spoke to me. He then took another looks on screen for live view and gave me his input. Final results came from my Dr. a few days later where she was more comfortable with me seeing a breast surgeon. Good luck, Hope you get good news quickly.
Posts.Title: Freaking Out! Jen77 cuddyclothes

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2016 08:13PM Emaca wrote: had my surgery today...I'm tired but no pain. I'm sure tomorrow I will be sore. I was there at 7 am...in preop I had my IV then a little sedation, I could not focus so I closed my eyes and asleep I was. I remember waking up in recovery for a quick bit but kept dozing. Then I went to step down and they let me sleep more, but they started getting me up. I was home a little after 130. My incision is about 2 inches and they painted on an adheasive dressing that is water proof. I spent the day in bed. Ice and sleep! Been drinking and had a few crackers about 4 and white elbow macaroni for dinner. Back to bed at 8! Have not needed any pain meds (yet) hopefully stays that way. If I may say so, this was easier than the core needle biopsy (did not like the sound of the pulling biopsy unit) I was good being asleep! Keep us posted tpappwill23

Posts.Title: I don't know where to start Briannek ChiSandy

Posts.Content: Emaca wrote: Background... 5 yrs ago found lump mammogram and ultrasound then biopsied and diagnosed with fibroadenoma ... yearly mammos all stable Fast forward March mammo showed more calcifications and lump has more than doubled in size (4.5x3.5x3cm) Surgical excision was June 6 due to growth and size.. Confirmed fibroadenoma again. Went to follow up and he said I should resume normal mammograms (next March). Is that normal or should I have a new baseline sooner? There will obviously be changes. Thanks in advance Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Wait and see, repeat core needle biopsy, or surgical removal? Emaca marie5890

Posts.Content: Emaca wrote: I had a Core Needle Biopsy 5 years ago (@age 40) with results of fibroadenoma with mild proliferative changes, small micro-calcification, and prominent stromal component. Note to monitor lesion size. The lesion has begun to grow and has doubled in size in a year. Had a mammogram and follow up ultrasound. Dr. did not have my pathology results but said not to worry. I should leave it. Of course my primary Dr. is on vacation for a week so I went to Internet. (Maybe not best choice). From my readings 1. If grows over age of 35...should remove 2. Could be misdiagnosed phyllodes tumor 3. Complex fibroadenoma should be removed Anyone have insight? Thank you in advance Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Wait and see, repeat core needle biopsy, or surgical removal? Emaca marie5890

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2016 07:47PM Emaca wrote: Primary Care DR has reached out to me over the weekend ... after reviewing all my records she suggested I see a breast surgeon. She sent me a copy of the latest ultrasound and a few things jumped out... this lump has been stable since 2011 until now (doubled in size in a year), more calcifications are visible since last mammogram (a year ago), and extremely dense breast tissue. Now the waiting begins for that appointment. What should I look for in a breast surgeon? What questions should I ask during the appointment? Thanks in advance
Posts.Title: Wait and see, repeat core needle biopsy, or surgical removal? Emaca marie5890

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2016 08:17PM Emaca wrote: met with the breast surgeon. Gave two options... Let it be and repeat the mammo and ultrasound every 3 months to monitor or surgical removal. The second option will take care of any worry in the future. His worry is at my age Fibroadenomas usually don't grow after they have been stable for this long. And at some point it should come out so it doesn't change the size and shape of the breast. Phyllodes tumor was something that he suggests it could be. Waiting to schedule.
